Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Basic Spot

o   Loose ball plays the basic spot of enforcement is from the Previous Spot:

§  Punt, exclude post scrimmage kick fouls

§  Legal forward pass

§  Backward pass, including the snap, or fumble made by A-1 from on or behind his/her scrimmage line

§  The run or runs which precedes such legal pass, punt, or fumble

o   Punts (before possession is gained) basic enforcement spot is previous spot (where ball was kicked from).

o   On all running plays the basic enforcement spot is from the end of the run.

o   All fouls are marked off from the basic enforcement spot except an offensive foul behind the basic enforcement spot that becomes a spot foul.

o   Live ball fouls committed by either team after B gains possession during a try or in overtime shall be enforced at the succeeding spot.

o   All dead ball fouls are administered separately and in the order of occurrence.

·         Loss of 5 yards

o   Delay of Game (Dead Ball Foul)

o   False Start (Dead Ball Foul)

o   Encroachment (Dead Ball Foul)

o   Illegal Snap (Dead Ball Foul)

o   Offensive player leaving the field on the wrong side (Dead Ball Foul)

o   Illegal Procedure

o   Illegal Formation

o   Illegal Motion

o   Illegal Shift

o   Player receiving snap within Two (2) Yards of Scrimmage Line

o   Illegal Forward Pass (Loss of Down, if by Team A)

o   Intentional Grounding (Loss of Down)

o   Illegal Substitution

o   Aiding Runner by Teammates

o   Required Equipment Worn Illegally

o   Offensive player Not Within15 Yards of the Ball, once the ready for play whistle is blown, the player may line-up outside the 15 yard zone

o   Player out-of-bounds when ball is snapped

o   Intentionally throwing a backward pass or fumble out-of-bounds (Loss of Down)

 

·         Loss of 10 Yards

o   Illegal Contact

o   Eligibility Lost by Going Out of Bounds and Participating in the Play

o   Offensive Pass Interference (Loss of Down)

o   Defensive Pass Interference (Automatic First Down)

o   Stiff Arm

o   Flag Guarding

o   Illegal Flag Belt Removal

o   Personal Foul

o   Roughing the Passer (Automatic First Down)

o   Illegally Secured Flag Belt on Touchdown (Team A - Loss of Down, Team B Automatic First Down, and Player Disqualification)

o   Illegal Participation

o   Illegal Kicking (treated as a fumble)

o   Illegal Stripping

o   Unsportsmanlike Conduct (Players, Coaches, Substitutes, or Others)

o   Illegal Player Equipment

o   Quick Kick

o   Spiking, Kicking, or Throwing Ball During Dead Ball

o   Batting a Free Ball

o   Receipt of an unsportsmanlike penalty

o   Two or more encroachment fouls during the Interval between downs

o   Hurdle Any Player

o   Kick Catch Interference

 

Tie Breaker  

·         Tie breakers are to only be used in the playoffs. During the regular season, all ties will remain as such.

·         Coin Toss

o   There will only be one coin toss in overtime. If additional overtime periods are played, the captains will alternate choices. The choices are: offense, defense, or direction. All overtime periods are played toward the same goal line.

·         Timeouts

o   Each team will receive one timeout for the entire overtime. Timeouts not used during regulation will not be carried over.

·         Unless moved by penalty, each team will start first and goal from the Team B 10 yard line.

·         Each team has four downs (unless there is an Automatic first down) to score.

·         Try

o   Will be the same as in regulation: 1 pt - 3 yd line, 2 pts - 10 yd line, 3 pts - 20 yd line.
